author: Anna Kitanaka
title: Nomura, Daiwa Stop Redemptions on Chinese Equity Funds Amid Rout
text:
Japan’s biggest securities firms blocked customers from buying and selling Chinese equity funds as trading halts leave half of mainland shares frozen amid a rout.
Nomura Holdings Inc.’s asset-management unit suspended redemptions from three funds as of Thursday, while saying it won’t take orders for two of them, according to a statement. Daiwa Securities Group Inc.’s fund-management arm stopped orders and redemptions on two funds tracking mainland A shares, it said separately.
More than 1,400 Chinese companies have suspended their shares amid a slump that’s wiped $3.9 trillion from the value of the world’s second-biggest equity market. fluctuated between a 2.6 percent gain and a 3.8 percent slump as of 10:40 a.m. local time.
Nomura “took into consideration the difficulty of calculating standard valuations, and decided to stop the buying and selling of funds temporarily,” the company said.
Daiwa said in its statement trading will be halted “for the time being,” citing low liquidity.
